explanation: The report is correct. MHD_cleanup_connections calls the user-supplied daemon->notify_connection callback while it has released the cleanup mutex (or never held it in non-threaded builds). A user callback is free to call back into the library (for example calling MHD_stop_daemon). In the case where MHD_stop_daemon takes the code path that invokes close_all_connections (e.g. when no separate polling thread is used, or otherwise depending on configuration), close_all_connections eventually calls MHD_cleanup_connections again. That yields an indirect call chain: MHD_cleanup_connections -> daemon->notify_connection (user callback) -> MHD_stop_daemon -> close_all_connections -> MHD_cleanup_connections, i.e. indirect re-entry/recursion. This violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 (no direct or indirect self-calls).
